content.description:
Mnestheus Encourages His Men

Non iam prima peto, MnestheusMnestheus, -i, m.: Mnestheus (a Trojan ship captain), neque vincere certocerto, -are = tempto, -are; 
(quamquam O!—Sed superent, quibus hoc, NeptuneNeptunus, -i, m.: Neptune, dedisti) 
extremos pudeatpudet, -ere = “let it be disgraceful” rediisse; hoc vincite, cives, 
et prohibeteprohibeo, -ere: to prevent nefasnefas, n. (indecl.): a horrible thing.
content.question: In Roman society, which of the following rights did only male citizens (cives, line 3) have?

choices.label: The right to a legal trial
The right to fight in Rome’s wars
The right to worship foreign gods
The right to engage in business activities

content.answer: The right to a legal trial

unit.text: 5: Vergil's Aeneid, Excerpts from Books 4, 6, 7, 11, and 12

skill.text: 2.B: Describe historical and cultural contexts of Latin texts.
